value: Image:Rincon de la Vieja Vulcano activity.JPG‎
Rincon de la Vieja Vulcano Activity in the National Park
Rincón de la Vieja Volcano National Park
Parque Nacional Rincon de la Vieja

is a park of 14,161 hectare covering a dry tropical forest region in the provinces of

, centered around the Volcano, Rincón de la Vieja, and the surrounding volcanic and natural features. Sights include an extraordinary amount of interesting flora and fauna, as well as plenty of hot bubbling sulphurous mud pits and a little "mini-volcano."

The closest park to the Papagayo, Coco, Hermosa, Flamingo, Tamarindo area. This park has lots of volcanic activity, fumaroles, boiling mud pots, vapor vents, sulfur vents, forests, wild life. Great for a one day tour with the whole family. There are more complicated trails for expert hikers as well, like the crater top or the sulfur springs "Los Azufrales". There is a convenience at the entrance of the park with bathrooms. The park is closed on Mondays.

This national park was created officially decreed on 23 October 1973, created on 10 May 1974, and ratified on 27 December 1982.

It is a part of the protected area of the Conservation Area Guanacaste, (ACG) and operates in conjunction with the National Parks of Guanacaste and Santa Rosa, the Vida Silvestre Wildlife Refuge and the Horizontes Experimental Forestry Station.

The park is divided into two sectors: Pailas and Santa Maria.

value: was named after the volcanic eruptions that are located in the area, including fumaroles and mud pots.
was, from the late nineteenth st century and the year of 1973 one of the largest ranches in the area. It ran both beef and dairy cattle, and produced coffee and sugar cane.

The park forms park of the

for the province of Guanacaste. The province has 32 rivers, including the el Colorado, Blanco and the  Ahogados. 

In addition, there are sixteen intermittent streams, which supply the rivers in the province.
Upper forest trees are of small stature and are twisted and covered with epiphytes. Rincon de la Vieja is a refuge for a large population the national flower
) are abundant, as are strangler figs (

).

Approximately 300 bird species inhabit the park including the Keel-billed Toucan (

).

Mammals in the park include three species of monkey: the white-headed capuchin (
) are also present.  Reptiles in the park include black iguanas (
The park is accessible only by car. From

it's 5 km north up the Inter-American Highway, turn right (east) towards Curubande and head 17 km, then keep going until you pass through Hacienda Guachipelin. The park hours are 7AM-3PM Tu-Su.

Be certain you have a spare tire and jack in your car. The gravel road has many sharp edges to the gravel. A two wheel drive can make the journey weather permitting. A four wheel drive car is advisable during the wet season.

value: address=Hacienda Guachipelin, Rincon de la Vieja National Park
directions=Next to Rincon de la Vieja National Park, from Liberia 5 km north, turn right 17 km towards the National Park.

content=The best one day tours in the area. From soft to hard adventure, hot springs, mud springs, horseback rides, canopy tours, white water tubing, canyoning, hiking, bird watching, wildlife and cultural activities. There is a full day package that includes a buffet style lunch. There are tours for different budgets
directions=Rinon  de la Vieja, at Guachipelin's main entrance
content=Restaurant with panoramic view of the coast line and the flat lands.
Laguna on the grounds of Hacienda Guachipelin
directions=Drive north from Liberia along Panamerican, take exit at Quebrada Grande and follow signs),

content=North base of Rincon de la Vieja volcano national park in the rainforest - Cabins among 4 natural mineral hot springs pools, a fresh water pool with a bullet waterslide,  full service a spa, botanical gardens, butterfly farm, tours to volcanic blue river, waterfalls, horseback riding, nature hikes and much more.

address=In Liberia, from Burger King 13 kilometers on the Interamericana road, towards Peñas Blancas, until you get to the entrance of Cañas Dulces –only entrance towards the east- (on the right hand side) that is paved, then you drive 18 kilometers towards the towns of Cañas Dulces and Buena Vista that are on the way
content=Presents the daily life in a Hacienda in Guanacaste. Has operated under sustainable tourism principles since 1991. Adventures tours are available in the hotel.
address=Rincon de la Vieja, Guanacaste, Costa rica
directions=From Liberia take road #1, 5 Km. turn right at Rincon de la Vieja Entrance 17 km, passing a gated entrance.

content=Nested in a hacienda at the base of the most visited volcano in Guanacaste. Still operating as a traditional cattle ranch. Closest hotel to National Park Rincon de la Viejat. Tours for all ages, from soft to hard adventure. Hiking, horseback rides, canopy tours, canyoning and white water tubing.
content=Opened in 1999. Take advantage of the curative properties that have long been attributed to mineral rich waters and mud-pots. 2 bungalow rooms with facilities as well as 1 Jr. suite. Have
rooms and public areas including the restaurant La Carreta, front desk and lobby, pool, spa, stables and other surrounding areas and strive to cope with any
. 5 room styles, can cater to weddings and special events.

directions=From Liberia, take the highway north 1.5 km.  Turn east onto the road for Rincon de la Vieja.  Go about 14km to Curubande.  2km after passing through town, find this place on your left.  There are signs for the 300m driveway on the right side of the road.  Small vehicles should drive up the driveway with care.
content=This is a 6-room B&B-style hotel with family-style meals and a nice location on the top of the hill.
content=This is a B&B-style place with both rooms and tent cabins.  Breakfast is offered, though dinner is not.
